page.title: 19Ghost village near Brackley
page.content: To reach Astwick village we went through a field. We got to a gate and a wall which is the remaining part of the old town hovel. It must have been quite big; we could see the foundations. The wall was 1.25m high and was made of grey stones stacked in a brick design. There were bumps all over the field with protruding stones arranged in lines so we could make out the foundations of the old cottages. They were bigger than we had expected. To reach the old fish pond we had to climb over a barbed wire fence and crosss a marshy riverbed which still had tall reeds growing in it. They were taller than I and I am 1.30m tall. From there we could see a shallow oval-shaped dip which was the fish pond. It was marshy with little pools in it and lots of reeds. The trees around it were very dense.
